hero.title: edu_assistant

license.title: License
license.description: MIT · contributions welcome for automation modules, UX, and offline support.

overview.title: A home copilot connected to your local ecosystem
overview.description: The project was created to manage routines, calendars, and projects without exposing sensitive data to external services. Everything runs on the user machine.

items.responses: Spoken responses ready for continuous, accessible interaction.

python.title: Python core
python.description: Modules organised by responsibility, following best practices and ready for future test coverage.

voice.title: Voice input and output

context.title: Smart context

├── main.py              # Voice/text interface
├── config.json          # Credentials and preferences
├── memory/              # Local memory, agenda, and vectors
├── data/projects/       # Project metadata
├── modules/
│   ├── voice_input.py   # Whisper API
│   ├── voice_output.py  # Edge TTS

│   ├── context_loader.py# Context inputs
│   ├── agenda.py        # Daily routine

└── requirements.txt     # Main dependencies

installation.title: Set up your assistant in minutes
installation.description: Follow the steps to prepare your environment, credentials, and start the conversational flow on desktop.

steps.clone: Clone the repository and create a virtual environment:
steps.config: Copy the example file and add your keys:

commands.clone:
git clone https://github.com/eduardo45MP/edu_assistant.git
cd edu_assistant
python3 -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # Linux/macOS
# .\venv\Scripts\activate  # Windows
commands.config:
cp config.example.json config.json
# Fill in API keys, preferences, and local paths

installation.note: Switch to text-only mode by replacing audio capture with CLI input if you do not have a microphone available.

hero.title: ReadMonitor
hero.description: A platform to track completed, in-progress, and planned reading, with detailed control over a personal library.

approach.label: Approach
approach.value: MVC architecture distributed across Controller (Next.js), Model (Node + Sequelize), and View (Expo).

goal.label: Goal
goal.value: Deliver a 360° view of reading progress with rich cataloguing and future reports.

features.title: Core features
features.description: Status management, full book metadata, and SQLite-backed synchronisation.

experience.title: Experience
experience.description: Web for administration, mobile for daily use via Expo.

overview.title: A digital library aligned with reading routines
overview.description: ReadMonitor centralises book tracking with a focus on quick lookups and detailed cataloguing.

items.dashboard: Dashboard with filtered lists by status: read, in progress, and want to read.
items.details: Full form with bibliographic details (ISBN, CDD, CDU, type, and availability).
items.integrations: Architecture ready for integration with external services or dashboards.

stack.title: Layered separation to scale with confidence
stack.description: Each component owns specific responsibilities, enabling independent testing and incremental evolution.

controller.title: Controller · Next.js
controller.description: Layer responsible for routes, REST APIs, and the admin dashboard.

model.title: Model · Node + Sequelize
model.description: Orchestrates persistence in SQLite and the business rules layer.

view.title: View · Expo
view.description: Mobile interface to add, browse, and update books quickly.

architecture.title: Directory organisation
architecture.description: The structure reinforces layer separation and simplifies independent deployments.
architecture.tree:
ReadMonitor/
├── Controller/   # Next.js for routes/admin
├── Model/        # Node.js + Sequelize + SQLite
├── View/         # Mobile app via Expo
├── db.sqlite3    # Local database
└── README.md     # Full documentation

installation.title: Layer-by-layer setup flow
installation.description: Prepare each module in its corresponding directory, ensuring environment variables and dependencies are correct.

commands.controller:
cd Controller
npm install
npm run dev  # Default port 3000
cd ..
commands.model:
cd Model
npm install
npm start     # Starts API + SQLite
cd ..
commands.view:
cd View
npm install
npm start    # Open the Expo app on your device
cd ..

installation.note: Align each layer configuration to the same database/endpoint. Consider seed scripts to populate initial data.

contributions.title: Ideas to evolve ReadMonitor
contributions.description: There is room for new features, integrations, and UX improvements across the web panel and the mobile app.

statistics.title: Statistics
statistics.description: Dashboards with reading time, favourite genres, and milestone tracking.

sync.title: Sync and backups
sync.description: Integrations with cloud services and automated library exports.

mobile.title: Mobile UX
mobile.description: Optimised flows for adding books with barcode scan or cover capture.

contributions.note: Review portfolio/docs/ROADMAP.md to align priorities and keep visual consistency with the guide in portfolio/docs/visualID.md.

installation.title: Host in minutes
installation.description: As a 100% frontend project, you only need to serve the static files on any host.

steps.clone: Clone the repository or fork it:
steps.deploy: Deploy to a static server (e.g. GitHub Pages):

hero.title: NSA | Network Security Assistant
hero.description: A modular toolkit that tests, analyses, and strengthens Wi-Fi networks with clear flows for scanning, assessment, and report generation.

scope.label: Scope
scope.value: Educational audits on owned networks, focused on common vulnerability detection.

access.label: Access
access.value: Python scripts executed locally, with administrative privileges when required.

modules.title: Core modules
modules.description: Wi-Fi scanner, security analysis, PDF reports, and configurable profile management.

platform.title: Target platform
platform.description: Linux environments; some features require sudo access and specific network libraries.

license.title: License
license.description: MIT · Respect the legal notice: use only on networks with explicit authorisation.

overview.title: Practical auditing for home and corporate Wi-Fi networks
overview.description: NSA was created to professionalise home security tests, offering clear, documented scripts that any cybersecurity enthusiast can extend.

items.networks: Maps available networks with relevant metadata (BSSID, RSSI, channel, declared security).
items.analysis: Evaluates encryption settings, signal strength, and common risks.
items.reports: Generates readable reports with checklists of recommendations and next steps.
items.profiles: Allows saving Wi-Fi profiles to repeat tests in regular cycles.

stack.title: Python as the base for security automation
stack.description: Networking libraries and report generation form the core of the toolkit, keeping the setup lean and portable.

scanning.title: Scanning and capture
scanning.description: Uses scapy, socket, and subprocess to gather interface information.

analysis.title: Analysis
analysis.description: Customisable rules to verify encryption types, default passwords, and protection best practices.

reports.title: Reports
reports.description: Generates friendly reports with pandas, jinja2, or reportlab depending on the flow.

architecture.title: Modular scripts for each step of the process
architecture.description: Clear separation between collection, analysis, reporting, and profile management avoids tight coupling and enables isolated tests.
architecture.tree:
NSA/
├── scan_wifi_networks.py   # Available network scanning
├── sec_analysis.py         # Security evaluation rules
├── sec_report.py           # Detailed report generation
└── wifi_profile.py         # Wi-Fi profile CRUD

installation.title: Preparing the audit environment
installation.description: Run the scripts on machines that support monitor mode and have the required privileges. Tests were validated on Debian-based Linux distributions.

steps.clone: Clone the repository and create a virtual environment:

commands.clone:
git clone https://github.com/eduardo45MP/NSA.git
cd NSA
python3 -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
commands.dependencies:
pip install -r requirements.txt  # when available
sudo apt install aircrack-ng net-tools wireless-tools
commands.run:
sudo python scan_wifi_networks.py
python sec_analysis.py
python sec_report.py

installation.note: Adjust commands for your environment and ensure write permissions on output directories when generating reports.

contributions.title: Best practices for collaboration
contributions.description: Contributors can expand security rules, report formats, and support for new platforms.

heuristics.title: New heuristics
heuristics.description: Add advanced checks to detect frequent insecure configurations.

templates.title: Report templates
templates.description: Create customisable layouts with charts, checklists, and audience-specific guidance.

tests.title: Automated tests
tests.description: Implement unit tests and mocks to simulate results without real hardware access.
